title: O'er the Atlantic;
author: W[hyte], W[illiam] E.
snippet: Airthrey Castle, the seat of Lord Abercrombie, and that of Sir William Stirling Maxwell, of Kerr, Kenneth Abbey, in which lies interred the remains of James III, and over which has been lately erected at the expense of her present majesty, the Queen, an elegant tomb in memory of that long departed monarch.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The seats at the Bridge of Allan and its immediate neighbourhood are, Westerton Park (now let), Airthrey Castle (Lord Abercromby), Keir (William Stirling, Esq.), Kippenross (John Stirling, Esq.)

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Airthrey Castle, and near to the north verge of the alluvial deposit of the river Forth.

title: Bohemian days;
author: Tadlock, Clara Moyse.
snippet: We crossed the bridge of Allan, near which is a greatresort for invalids and pleasure seekers, Airthrey wells, andAirthrey Castle.

title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: Airthrey Castle, on the north side of the river, nearto the Wallace Monument at Stirling; Earl of Marand Kcllie, Alloa House ; Earl of Zetland, Clackmannan Castle ; Lord Balfour of Burleigh, KennetHouse ; and Lord William Gololphin Osborne, uncleof the present Duke of Leeds, of Tallyallan Castle.
